intro: Tetragonolobus siliquosus var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored siliquous tetragonolobus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive two-colored foliage, with upper and lower leaf surfaces displaying different hues. The plant produces small, elongated pods that contain seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its unique coloration and growth habits make it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural interest.
